intro: Epigynum lachnocarpum, commonly known as the sticky false flax, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant produces small, sticky fruits that adhere to animals, aiding in seed dispersal. It is native to parts of Europe and grows in open, disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it distinctive among its relatives in the carrot family.
